item.title: CA hails EC for announcing schedule for national polls, referendum
item.description: Chief Adviser Professor Muhammad Yunus today (Thursday) extended his heartfelt congratulations to the Election Commission (EC) for announcing the schedule of the 13th National Parliamentary Election and the referendum on the July National Charter (Constitutional Reform) Implementation Order 2025.

item.title: Ageing Germany set to get smaller and older, says stats office
item.description: Ageing Germany’s population could shrink by almost 10 million people, to around 75 million, by 2070 as the baby boomer generation gives way to much smaller cohorts, the statistics office said. In its latest population forecast, published on Thursday, the office said it expected one in four p

item.title: Egg price falls, farmers sell their product at loss
item.description: The price of commercially produced eggs has fallen recently, resulting in loss to farmers. Farmers said high price for the animal product over the last few years motivated them to increase production, surpassing the demand and leading to very low egg prices and losses to them. Farmers sold per pi

item.title: 910th Executive Committee meeting of Shahjalal Islami Bank held
item.description: The 910th meeting of the Executive Committee (EC) of Shahjalal Islami Bank PLC. (SJIB PLC) was held on 10th December 2025 at Corporate Head Office of the bank. The meeting was presided over by Mr. Akkas Uddin Mollah, the Chairman of Executive Committee (EC) of the bank, according to a media releas

item.title: Flat as ‘bribe’: Tulip faces prosecution
item.description: The Anti-Corruption Commission (ACC) has approved a chargesheet against UK Labour MP Tulip Siddiq over allegations that she received a flat at Dhaka’s Gulshan as a bribe. The flat was allegedly obtained from Eastern Housing Limited after orchestrating the illegal transfer of a plot through a

item.title: CID charges ex-minister Dastagir Gazi over ‘laundering’
item.description: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has brought charges of money laundering against former textiles and jute minister Golam Dastagir Gazi and seven others involving Tk 870 million. The CID informed the media about the filing of the case on Thursday. The suspects in the case include his pe

item.title: Belgium deputy PM: Russian frozen assets to be used for Ukraine loan
item.description: Russian frozen assets will have to be used for Ukraine at some point, Belgium’s deputy prime minister Vincent Van Peteghem said on Thursday, added however Belgium “would not take any reckless compromises” before it agreed to any deal over this. “At some point, these frozen

item.title: European bird flu spike due to record wild birds cases, EFSA says
item.description: An unprecedented number of bird flu outbreaks among wild birds and their wide geographic spread are driving an early and strong wave of the disease in Europe this year, the European Food Safety Authority said on Thursday. Highly pathogenic avian influenza has led to the culling of hundreds of mill

item.title: Khaleda remains in critical state under intensive treatment: Board
item.description: BNP Chairperson and former Prime Minister Begum Khaleda Zia remains in critical condition at Evercare Hospital, where she is on ventilator support and receiving intensive care for multiple serious complications, according to the medical board overseeing her treatment. In its latest update provided

item.title: Tobacco industry alarmed at govt’s reluctance to allow stakeholder-inclusive consultation
item.description: Leading companies in the tobacco industry today issued a joint statement, expressing their serious concerns over the government’s attempt to pass the proposed amendment to the Tobacco Control Act without a stakeholder-inclusive consultation in the absence of appropriate Parliamentary process.

item.title: Child rescued after 32 hours in Rajshahi well
item.description: The Fire Service has rescued a 2-year-old child from a borehole in Rajshahi, 32 hours after he slipped in. The Fire Service recovery team retrieved the toddler, identified as Sajid Hossain, around 9pm on Thursday using a tunnel dug next to the well in Tanore Upazila. The incident occurred on Wedn

item.title: BB purchases $149m from 16 banks to stabilise forex rate
item.description: Bangladesh Bank has purchased a significant amount of US dollars from local banks as part of its ongoing efforts to stabilise the foreign exchange market and support the flow of remittances and repatriate export earnings. On Thursday (December 11), the central bank acquired approximately $149 mill
